docs.title: OECD Transfer Pricing Guidelines
docs.text:
The OECD Transfer Pricing Guidelines provide guidance on the application of the arm's length principle for the valuation of cross-border transactions between associated enterprises.

Key principles:
- Arm's length principle: transactions should be priced as if between independent parties
- Comparable uncontrolled price method (CUP)
- Resale price method
- Cost plus method
- Transactional net margin method (TNMM)
- Profit split method

Documentation requirements:
- Master file (group-wide information)
- Local file (country-specific transactions)
- Country-by-Country reporting (CbCR) for MNEs with revenue > €750M

docs.title: EU VAT Directive - One Stop Shop (OSS)
docs.text:
The EU One Stop Shop (OSS) simplifies VAT obligations for businesses selling goods and services cross-border within the EU.

Types of OSS:
- Union OSS: for EU-established businesses selling to consumers in other EU countries
- Non-Union OSS: for non-EU businesses selling digital services to EU consumers
- Import OSS (IOSS): for distance sales of imported goods up to €150

Thresholds:
- €10,000 annual threshold for using domestic VAT rates on cross-border B2C sales
- Above threshold: VAT of destination country applies

Registration: in one EU Member State, covers all EU sales
Reporting: quarterly VAT returns
Payment: single payment to registration Member State

docs.title: IAS/IFRS - International Accounting Standards
docs.text:
International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) are global accounting standards for preparing financial statements.

Key standards:
- IFRS 15: Revenue from Contracts with Customers
- IFRS 16: Leases (right-of-use assets)
- IFRS 9: Financial Instruments
- IAS 1: Presentation of Financial Statements
- IAS 12: Income Taxes
- IAS 38: Intangible Assets

Financial statements components:
1. Statement of financial position (balance sheet)
2. Statement of comprehensive income
3. Statement of changes in equity
4. Statement of cash flows
5. Notes

Adopted by over 140 countries, including the EU (mandatory for listed companies).

docs.title: Convention fiscale OCDE - Modèle de convention
docs.text:
Le Modèle de Convention fiscale de l'OCDE sert de base aux traités bilatéraux pour éviter la double imposition.

Principes clés:
- Résidence fiscale (Art. 4)
- Établissement stable (Art. 5)
- Bénéfices des entreprises (Art. 7)
- Dividendes (Art. 10)
- Intérêts (Art. 11)
- Redevances (Art. 12)
- Gains en capital (Art. 13)
- Revenus d'emploi (Art. 15)

Méthodes d'élimination de la double imposition:
- Méthode de l'exemption
- Méthode du crédit d'impôt

Procédure amiable (Art. 25) pour résoudre les différends.

docs.title: ILO - International Labour Standards
docs.text:
The International Labour Organization (ILO) sets international labour standards through conventions and recommendations.

Fundamental conventions:
1. Freedom of Association (C87, C98)
2. Forced Labour (C29, C105)
3. Child Labour (C138, C182)
4. Discrimination (C100, C111)

Key standards:
- Minimum wage
- Working hours (max 48h/week, 8h/day)
- Paid annual leave (min 3 weeks)
- Maternity protection (14 weeks minimum)
- Occupational safety and health

Member states: 187 countries
Tripartite structure: governments, employers, workers

docs.title: Incoterms 2020 - International Commercial Terms
docs.text:
Incoterms are internationally recognized commercial terms defining seller and buyer responsibilities in international trade.

Rules for any mode of transport:
- EXW (Ex Works): seller delivers at their premises
- FCA (Free Carrier): seller delivers to carrier
- CPT (Carriage Paid To): seller pays carriage
- CIP (Carriage and Insurance Paid To): seller pays carriage + insurance
- DAP (Delivered at Place): seller delivers at destination
- DPU (Delivered at Place Unloaded): seller delivers and unloads
- DDP (Delivered Duty Paid): seller bears all costs and risks

Sea and inland waterway transport only:
- FAS, FOB, CFR, CIF

Published by ICC (International Chamber of Commerce)

docs.title: BEPS - Base Erosion and Profit Shifting
docs.text:
The OECD/G20 BEPS Project addresses tax avoidance strategies that exploit gaps in tax rules.

BEPS 2.0 - Pillar One:
- Reallocation of taxing rights to market jurisdictions
- Applies to MNEs with global revenue > €20B and profitability > 10%
- Amount A: 25% of residual profits reallocated

BEPS 2.0 - Pillar Two (GloBE):
- Global minimum tax rate of 15%
- Applies to MNEs with revenue > €750M
- Income Inclusion Rule (IIR)
- Undertaxed Profits Rule (UTPR)
- Qualified Domestic Minimum Top-up Tax (QDMTT)

Implementation: 2024-2025 for most jurisdictions

docs.title: EU GDPR - Data Protection Regulation
docs.text:
The General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) is the EU regulation on data protection and privacy.

Key principles:
- Lawfulness, fairness, transparency
- Purpose limitation
- Data minimization
- Accuracy
- Storage limitation
- Integrity and confidentiality
- Accountability

Data subject rights:
- Right of access
- Right to rectification
- Right to erasure ('right to be forgotten')
- Right to data portability
- Right to object

Penalties:
- Up to €20M or 4% of global annual turnover

Data Protection Officer (DPO) required for large-scale processing.
